title.narrative: Integrated Food Security Project, Phase II - Caritas Mombasa

description.narrative:
This is phase 2 of the Integrated Food Security Project (IFSP 2), Arch Diocese of Mombasa, in Kwale and Mombasa Counties (KENYA) In this second phase the IFSP targets to reach people and communities in three sub counties of Mombasa and Kwale namely: Lunga lunga and Kisauni Sub county.
A total of 1,200 direct beneficiaries (500 males and 700 (female) will be reached over three years, by 2021.
This project aims to sustain food security interventions through an integrated approach. The integration strategy will promote food production, livestock rearing (gala goats and poultry), and income generation for target beneficiaries. SILC group methodology will be used as an entry point for planned activities. In addition, participating community groups will be supported sustainably to manage their natural resources responsibly and to actively engage in Community Led Total Sanitation (CLTS).
It is anticipated that this project will immensely contribute towards achieving food security for Mombasa and Kwale Counties. Low crop and livestock productivity is mainly caused by: inadequate/erratic rainfall, Crop failure which is widespread in the mixed farming livelihood zones; and inadequate pasture in livestock farming zone. Project interventions are expected to contribute towards sustainable food security, diversified household incomes, and responsible use of natural resources amongst the communities living in Mwakirunge (Kisauni subcounty) and Lunga lunga Sub county by July 2021.
Project Outcomes: Outcome 1: Households sustainably produce adequate food to meet their needs and generate surplus Outcome 2: Households have access to stable and diversified income (for dignified livelihoods) Outcome 3: Communities sustainably manage water and natural resources
Overall, Caritas Mombasa will contribute towards the overall programme goal of: Sustainable food security, Resilience and peaceful co-existence for poor and vulnerable communities in Kenya
